title: bs241
author: bs241
content: Somewhat of a lurker on this forum but I have built up (and recently rediscovered) my collection of Polymerbit notes built up over the last several years. I haven’t decided if I would part with all these yet, but I’d be interested in finding a rough value and if there would be any interest. As I’m sure there are more knowledgeable people here although I have done some research. The error notes are the 1/10 Eth ‘Bitcoin Document’ and the 2 mBTC triangle.http://http://http://http://

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: will need to compare to what I have but I may be interested if there are ones I do not yet have.

comments.author: BobbyCoins
comments.created_time: February 01, 2023, 05:11:11 PMLast edit: February 01, 2023, 06:12:55 PM by BobbyCoins
comments.body: From the Polymerbit notes collection I built up in the last years you'll find retail-prices (= upper limit) for some of them here: https://www.coinsofnakamoto.com/collectibles/notes/Some notes are worth just 10 bucks (like the garlic & via notes), most notes are between 20-30 bucks (like the LTC, ETH, 1776, bees, triangle, 1/10th, 1/20th, Test & Custom).The Monero note was sold recently here on the board and from what I see just a few could be worth more, like the blue 0.1 BTC note... see link above!I bought most of my Polymerbits in bundles, averaging at about $25 per note of the notes I see in your pics.I can't tell you prices for the notes I'd be interested in (red 1 BTC, violet 20, orange 100, brown 200, blue 10 MBTC... sry for the abbreviations used) but I wouldn't pay more than the $25 per note already stated, maybe $50 for the red 1 BTC. But that's just because I like it and I don't have it yet.Edit.Of course: price estimates are for unfunded notes.
